text: It is unjust to pass the buck to Mr. Hammarskjold and the UN's servants. The responsibility rightly belongs to the nations which have undertaken the task of preserving peace in the Congo. That is not a ceremonial duty, and the soldiers have every right to blame the politicians unless they see it through. When the United Nations instructed Mr. Hammarskjold to use force if necessary to prevent civil war, it was clear that new dangers would arise unless it gave him the physical power to comply with the policy.
